segments.text: I see an adult woman standing by the sink, seemingly absorbed in her task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her dress and apron give her an air of domesticity, but I can’t help but feel surprised that she hasn’t noticed the overflowing water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is forming a nice puddle at her feet, and it’s almost comical how oblivious she appears to be.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it’ll take for her to realize the disaster unfolding right beneath her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children, on the other hand, are the real story here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the boy precariously balancing on that wobbly stool, and my heart races a little just thinking about the fall he could take.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, the girl is standing there with her hand raised, totally anticipating her reward.
segments.speaker: PAR
